{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3423348,"name":null,"username":"Yamada","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/y/c4cdca/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T14:07:10.641Z","cooked":"

Hello!

Our team is currently struggling with programming the swerve robot. Every time we enable the robot, each of the swerve modules oscillate in place while propped up off of the ground. The team has tried adjusting the PID values and it seems to make no effect.

The swerve robot has the Thrifty Bot Absolute Magnetic Encoders and uses the NEO motors for the turning and drive. Code was written using YAGSL and can be found here: GitHub - UnFairArk/YAGSL

Any help or insight would be greatly appreciated!

Can you use this shuffleboard layout and move your wheels counterclockwise while your robot is disabled. Both the absolute encoder readings and angle motor readings should increase.

You probably have a bad inversion issue in your angle motors or absolute encoders.

yagsl.gitbook.io

Telemetry | YAGSL

What swerve modules are you using?

Another reason why I like the MAXSwerve approach to zeroing and inversions. Using a zeroing tool and offsets in the code.

Seems much more foolproof.

The team tested using telemetry. The absolute encoder value increased but the angle encoder value decreased. We are stumped on how to proceed.

Invert your angle motors that are decreasing. Also your drive motor inversions should be uniform, you have 2 differing ones.

1st lets set all inversions to false.

github.com

UnFairArk/YAGSL/blob/main/src/main/deploy/swerve/modules/backleft.json#L17-L19


      
    
          
  1. "inverted": {
    2. 
          
  2.   "drive": false,
    3. 
          
  3.   "angle": true
    4.
github.com

UnFairArk/YAGSL/blob/main/src/main/deploy/swerve/modules/backright.json#L17-L19


      
    
          
  1. "inverted": {
    2. 
          
  2.   "drive": true,
    3. 
          
  3.   "angle": true
    4.
github.com

UnFairArk/YAGSL/blob/main/src/main/deploy/swerve/modules/frontleft.json#L17-L19


      
    
          
  1. "inverted": {
    2. 
          
  2.   "drive": true,
    3. 
          
  3.   "angle": true
    4.
github.com

UnFairArk/YAGSL/blob/main/src/main/deploy/swerve/modules/frontright.json#L17-L19


      
    
          
  1. "inverted": {
    2. 
          
  2.   "drive": true,
    3. 
          
  3.   "angle": false
    4.

Then check your telemetry. If angle motors are decreasing set all of these to true.

    6.

    7.

    8. 
          
  8.   },
    9.

    11.

    12.

    14.

    15.

    16.

    17.

    19.

    20.

    21.
